Top 30 Most Visited Websites | Generated by AI

Home 2025.10

While the concept of a definitive “top 30” websites can be subjective and fluctuate based on various metrics like traffic, user engagement, and regional popularity, here’s a list compiled from various sources, reflecting the most widely visited and influential websites globally as of late May 2025.

It’s important to note that rankings can vary slightly between different analytics providers. This list aims to provide a broad overview of the internet landscape.

Top 30 Most Visited Websites (General Overview):

  1. Google.com: The leading search engine globally, serving as a primary gateway to the internet.
  2. YouTube.com: The dominant online video-sharing platform with a massive user base.
  3. Facebook.com: The largest social networking site, connecting billions worldwide.
  4. Wikipedia.org: A collaborative, free online encyclopedia, a vast source of information.
  5. Instagram.com: A popular social media platform focused on photo and video sharing.
  6. X.com (formerly Twitter): A social networking and microblogging service for real-time updates and discussions.
  7. TikTok.com: A short-form video hosting service that has gained immense popularity.
  8. Amazon.com: The world’s largest online marketplace for e-commerce.
  9. WhatsApp.com: A widely used messaging and voice-over-IP service.
  10. Reddit.com: A network of communities where users discuss and share content on various topics.
  11. Yahoo.com: A web portal offering news, email, search, and other services.
  12. Microsoft.com: The official website for Microsoft, providing information on its products and services.
  13. LinkedIn.com: A professional networking platform for career development and job seeking.
  14. Baidu.com: The leading search engine in China.
  15. Yandex.ru: The most popular search engine in Russia.
  16. Yahoo.co.jp: The Japanese version of Yahoo, a popular web portal in Japan.
  17. Netflix.com: A leading streaming service for movies and TV shows.
  18. MSN.com: A web portal offering news, entertainment, and other content from Microsoft.
  19. Live.com: Microsoft’s web portal, including Outlook.com for email.
  20. Pinterest.com: A visual discovery engine for ideas like recipes, home decor, and style.
  21. Office.com: Microsoft’s online suite of productivity apps like Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.
  22. Globo.com: A major news and media portal in Brazil.
  23. Canva.com: A popular online graphic design platform.
  24. IMDb.com: The Internet Movie Database, a comprehensive source of information on films and TV shows.
  25. Apple.com: The official website for Apple products and services.
  26. Samsung.com: The official website for Samsung electronics and products.
  27. ESPN.com: A leading sports news and entertainment website.
  28. nytimes.com: The online platform for The New York Times newspaper.
  29. CNN.com: A major global news website.
  30. BBC.co.uk: The online platform for the British Broadcasting Corporation, a major news and media outlet.

General Information and Useful Details:

  • Search Engines: Google, Baidu, Yandex, and Bing are crucial for finding information online. Google consistently dominates in most parts of the world.
  • Social Media: Facebook, Instagram, X (formerly Twitter), TikTok, and Reddit are key platforms for communication, entertainment, and news dissemination. Their popularity varies across demographics and regions.
  • E-commerce: Amazon is the leading global online marketplace. Regional players like Yahoo! Japan and potentially others not in the top global ranking might be very significant in their specific markets.
  • Information and Reference: Wikipedia is an invaluable resource for a wide range of topics due to its collaborative nature.
  • Entertainment: YouTube and Netflix are giants in online video, catering to different content consumption habits.
  • Professional Networking: LinkedIn is essential for career-related activities.
  • News and Media: Websites like Yahoo News, Globo, The New York Times, CNN, and BBC.co.uk are important sources for staying informed about current events.
  • Technology and Software: Microsoft and Apple’s websites provide access to their products, services, and support.
  • Utilities and Tools: Websites like Canva offer online tools for design and creativity.

Important Considerations:

  • Regional Variations: The popularity of websites can differ significantly by country. For example, while Google is globally dominant, Baidu is the top search engine in China.
  • Mobile vs. Desktop: While this list primarily reflects website traffic, many of these services also have highly popular mobile apps, and in some cases, app usage might surpass website visits.
  • Dynamic Nature: The internet is constantly evolving, and the popularity and ranking of websites can change over time due to trends, new platforms, and shifts in user behavior.

This list provides a snapshot of some of the most prominent websites in the current online landscape. Depending on your specific interests and needs, other websites might be more relevant to you.
